text: Coker University’s liberal arts core and career skills are what you need to succeed.
Becoming the top job candidate starts with choosing the right program.
Go directly to a program that interests you, or spend some time exploring your options. It’s time to discover where you belong!
Get all the answers to your financial aid questions.
Coker University is a great value, and there are many resources available for you to pay for your education. Get the degree and career you want, without a huge debt burden.
Choose the Right Plan for You
Applying is free, easy, and we have all the support you might need.

The admissions process doesn’t have to be difficult or complicated. We’ve streamlined everything, waived all the application fees, and Coker University’s admissions staff are here to help. Apply today!
Enjoy the view from here—it’s your future.
What really makes Coker University a good fit for students like you? Have a look at the reasons so many others have decided this is the place they want to start building their future success.
Coker University Confers 49 Master’s Degrees and 74 Bachelor’s Degrees at Winter 2019 Commencement Ceremonies
Coker University Hires Six New Faculty Members
Mr. P.L. “Roy” McCall, Jr., Gives $1.2 Million to Coker University’s School of Visual and Performing Arts

Earlier this month, Society Hill, S.C., resident and philanthropist Mr. P.L. “Roy” McCall, Jr., gave an outright gift of $1.2 million to Coker University’s School of Visual and Performing Arts. McCall’s generous gift is one of the largest in Coker University’s history.
Your college story starts here. Coker will surround you with a nurturing, inclusive community that’s invested in your personal success—from the first day of school until graduation and beyond.
When it’s time for the next chapter of your story, Coker gives you both the flexibility and the support you need to create a better, brighter future.
At Coker, we do all we can to ensure that you succeed at the highest level. Often, that includes helping you balance your professional and educational path with your family life. We get it.

Coker University’s admissions process is easy for new students, transfers, and online applicants. Review all the information you need to apply.

A Coker University degree will help you pursue your career goals, and we are delighted that you are interested in applying for admission. If you’re new to the college admissions process, we know it can be daunting and overwhelming. And if you’ve been applying to several schools, we know the process can be exhausting!
Our goal here is the same, no matter where you’re coming from—we want to explain the admissions process as clearly as possible and give you all the resources you need to apply to Coker University.
along the way if you ever need us!
The Admissions Process at Coker University

The admissions process is slightly different, depending on the degree you’re seeking and if you’re transferring from another school. Before we get to the specific resources you need, let’s outline the general admissions process for students.
If you’ve never attended college before, you will need to:
Complete and submit your official application for admission.
Submit your high school transcripts and SAT/ACT scores.
Please remember, you will need to submit your official transcripts for all dual enrollment credits and AP class scores. These are required before you can officially enroll.
, or send them by regular mail, here:
You will need our school code:
Remember that the deadline to complete the FAFSA is June 30 each year for SC residents.
If you have already earned college credit hours from another institution, you will need to:
Complete and submit your official application for admission
Submit your official high school and college transcripts from all institution(s) you have attended, even if you didn’t graduate from those institutions.
to us, or send them by regular mail, here:
You will need our school code:
If you have already earned your bachelor’s degree and would like to pursue one of Coker’s master’s degrees, you will need to:
Submit your admissions portfolio, including official college transcripts from all institution(s) you’ve attended, by email to
If sending documents by regular mail, send to:
You will need Coker’s school code:
Remember to complete your FAFSA no later than two weeks before your graduate program begins. Graduate students are eligible for up to $20,500 per academic year in Unsubsidized Stafford loans.
We have organized the admissions information you need according to the different kinds of students who apply at Coker University:

We are so glad you’re considering Coker University for your undergraduate degree! We are already invested in your personal success, and you will have a real part in our community if you choose Coker. Everything you need to finish the application process is right here.

If you’re coming to us from another institution, welcome to Coker! Hopefully, you’ve already gotten a sense of the close-knit community and culture we value here—and we hope you will be a part of it very soon! We have gathered all of the admissions and transfer student information you’ll need in one place, so you can stay on track.

Wherever you are in the world, we’re glad you’re thinking of pursuing one of Coker University’s online bachelor’s degree programs. We’ve tried to make it easy for you to access all the information and resources you need to apply, but remember, we’re always here for you if you need assistance!

Welcome back to school! Since you already know the ropes of the college admissions process, let’s get right to the resources you need to complete your application and apply for financial aid. We’ve gathered all those resources for you in one place, and we’re always here to help, whenever you need us!
An Admissions Event That’s Just Your Speed

Maybe you want to meet a lot of people and have conversations so you can ask all of your important questions. Or maybe you want to come by, check things out in a low-pressure situation and not be in the spotlight while you see what you think. No matter how you’d like to get to know us, we’ve got an admissions event that will feel just right.

You pick the path in this option. Take 30 minutes to sit down with an admissions counselor, and follow that meeting with an hour-long tour of campus. The next stop is up to you! Experience one of our signature Round Table discussion-based classes, meet one-on-one with a professor in a major you’re thinking about, or spend some time with a coach if you’re interested in one of our DII athletics teams. All of these options are on the table for you
During Open Houses, future Cobras like you come to campus as a group to:
Listen in on financial aid session
Take a tour led by some of our current students
Have the chance to look over the different majors and meet professors at an academic fair
Have an optional meeting with an admissions counselor
Attend presentations of your choice, hosted by faculty and staff
…and lots more to help you see what Coker University is all about!
We also have Honors Day events for students interested in the Honors Program at Coker, a Scholarship Weekend, special group tour options, and more.
Take a look at our Campus Visits
to learn more about our different events.

Your admissions counselor will be a huge help in connecting you with the resources, information, and support you may need as you’re applying to Coker University. If you don’t have a counselor helping you yet, just
and someone will be in touch right away to see how we can assist.
Visit Coker University and See For Yourself

Reading the information on our website and program previews will give you a good overview of the exceptional value and quality of a Coker University degree—but to really understand the opportunities you’ll find here, you should come visit! We love to roll out the red carpet for our future Cobras when you come to campus for a tour.

See for yourself why Coker has such a trusted reputation. If you’d like, you can meet with the staff in Financial Aid, Admissions, and your academic department to learn more and help you make a final decision. We have a variety of ways for you to visit campus for a tour, so
and book a reservation with us today!
